column4: hey all, my company just allocated a small budget for funding open source projects. *besides ubuntu* where do you think we should point it to do the most good?
aloha_: lol
we have a small budget for funding open source projects. *besides ubuntu* where do you guys think we should point it to do the most good?
seveas, aloha: do you think its smarter to donate to larger or smaller projects? i wasnt sure
aloha: I just don't really know who needs the cash the most, you know?
Wikimedia
yes, Gnash
oh, also, check out the Uira project. It's for flash creating in Linux
thank you, that looks very interesting
then Uira. It's the only one of it's kind.
yeah, that one's looking quite promising
urg. uira's shut down.
really? They've come such a long way since I last checked them in '06 ;;
oh. It's a shame
well, according to wikipedia- the site says 'under heavy construction'
nah, they shut down due to a french law.
government: cause none of us is as stupid as all of us
I checked them only a week ago and saw they had a UI, and was prepared for a real version so I could erase my Windows partition that only is there because of Flash 8. This is really bothering me. :(
yeah, we have a client where we were able to free them from all but one windows install, but they had to have the one for flash dev. i was really hoping uira was going to work out
anyway, I hope you find someone to donate to. I can't honestly say the Ubuntu project is in big need of donations.
the absence of a 'donate' button on the page kind of clued us in on that one lol
lol
